## SDQ vs PIL: Discovering New Insights With Ease

When confronted with the task of harmonising the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) with the Purpose in Life Questionnaire (PIL), researchers often encounter challenges. The endeavour demands both time and precision. Leveraging Harmony, however, can alleviate the complexities associated with 'SDQ vs PIL'. The software, equipped with natural language processing and generative AI models, ensures an efficient, accurate, and streamlined comparison between the two psychological assessment instruments.



{{< image src="/images/gad7-becks.jpg" alt="SDQ vs PIL" title="SDQ vs PIL" >}}

{{< card heading="Try Harmony" copy="Compare SDQ and PIL " url="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app" >}}

{{< youtube cEZppTBj1NI >}}





Harmony's remarkable capability to harmonise not only SDQ and PIL, but a plethora of questionnaires, is a breakthrough in psychological and social science research. In the juxtaposition of 'SDQ vs PIL', Harmony illuminates overlaps, variances, and unique patterns through its analytical prowess. Providing a percentage match for each item between SDQ and PIL, it nullifies the conventional, laborious task of manually comparing these questionnaires. Such innovation aids researchers in harnessing the full potential of their studies, fostering cross-study comparisons, and scrutinizing the influence of social changes. 

## Compare the items in SDQ and PIL

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and PIL into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just PIL into Harmony</a> - compare PIL with other instruments


The task of 'SDQ vs PIL' is further simplified with Harmony's multilingual proficiency. Its vast database of instruments and easy-to-use web interface enable researchers to select existing instruments or input their own. Simply drag and drop the PDFs into Harmony's web interface, and voila, the task of harmonising 'SDQ vs PIL' becomes a breeze.
